definition: to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: And did you know Feifei that it's also a verb – to mansplain?
sentences.chinese: 菲菲，你知道“男人說教”也是一個動詞嗎？

sentences.english: No wonder they say that education decides the proGREss, prosperity and civilization of a country.
sentences.chinese: 難怪，有人說教育決定一個國家的進步，繁榮與文化。

sentences.english: Our approach is educational and wholly voluntary.
sentences.chinese: 我們的方法是說教式的完全自願的。

sentences.english: It was just a little too preachy-sounding, Mr. Vitrano says.
sentences.chinese: 維特拉諾說，聽上去有點兒像是在說教。

sentences.english: I do not preach and I do not judge.
sentences.chinese: 我不會說教也不做評判。

sentences.english: When the fox preaches, then take care of your geese.
sentences.chinese: 每當狐狸說教，當心鵝羣被盜。
他的說教聽起來很空洞。

sentences.english: I don’t want to bore you with a fashion lecture
sentences.chinese: 只是，我可不想成爲一個教你怎麼做潮人的說教者。

sentences.english: On the third flight lay a heap of dead men's heads, and they directed him still another flight higher.
sentences.chinese: 三樓是一堆死人頭，它們也說教父住在上面一層。

sentences.english: Nagging serves no useful purpose for preventing puppy love.
sentences.chinese: 沒完沒了的說教對於防止孩子們早戀毫無用處。

sentences.english: Everytime he gets drunk, he goes into his lousy preaching routine.
sentences.chinese: 每次喝醉，他就開始他那令人討厭的說教。

sentences.english: The author moralizes excessively in this work.
sentences.chinese: 作者在這部作品中說教過多。

sentences.english: Still, Mr Wang says, he understands the risk of being too preachy.
sentences.chinese: 不過，王健林表示，他知道說教性過強會有風險。

sentences.english: However it should avoid being didactic .
sentences.chinese: 不過這必須避免說教的方式。

sentences.english: Everytime he gets drunk,he goes into lousy preaching routine.
sentences.chinese: 每次喝醉，他就開始他那令人討厭的說教。

definition: to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to imbue with/to inculcate/to instill into/to teach/to impart/to channel water to another place
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
to argue/to reason with sb/to talk sense/to be reasonable
to understand/to pay attention to/to take notice of
